answers.answer: "What cause high sugar readings without having diabetes?"Not enough information in your post to answer properly. When exactly are the times these "sugar readings" are taking place? Makes a big difference if it was first thing in the morning before he had anything to eat or drink, or directly after meals. Also, make, model of glucose meter and how often it is calibrated. Has he been tested at a doctor's office? When? And what were the results?

High blood sugar,  if this is what your husband has, ARE a sign of diabetes.  They are usually not a sign of anything else (unless someone is sick or on steroids, in which case levels can be temporarily high).Initially they can be the only obvious sign, which is why it is so important that people have diabetes screening at their annual checkups.Your husband should be looking into this with his doctor further and taking appropriate steps to manage  it.Likely this can be very effective seeing it has been caught before he has any bad effects from it.
